topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.1: Compute Service Overview

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Compute Service leverages the OpenStack Nova compute service to instantiate virtual machine instances on publicly accessible physical machines hosted in your cloud environment.

Compute allows you to work with flavors, which are unique combinations of disk space, memory capacity, and CPU; images, which are collections of files used as a base installation, typically operating systems; and servers, which are virtual instances created by combining a flavor and an image.
The variety of flavors and images supported by HP Helion OpenStack provide a wide range of options for building your instances.

section.title: Working with the Compute Service
section.p: The easiest way to perform Compute service tasks is through the HP Helion OpenStack Dashboard. The Dashboard provides a graphical interface for managing your instances.
The following list represents typical Compute service tasks for Users. Administrators will be able to perform additional management tasks.

ul.li:
Instance Management
Create/Edit/Terminate
Soft/Hard Reboot
Rebuild
Start/Stop

section.p: You can also access the HP Compute service through the command-line client or use a low-level, raw REST API. Refer to the OpenStack guide for client installation instructions.

ul.li: Troubleshooting the HP Helion OpenStack Compute Service

li.p: The OpenStack Operations Guide. The Operations section contains valuable management information. While the Architecture section contains interesting information about how an OpenStack Cloud is put together, HP Helion OpenStack takes care of these details for you.
